title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5903.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5903.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

For the purpose of this Part: (a) The term foundation means the New York

State Science and Technology Foundation, with headquarters at 99 Washington

Avenue, Albany, NY12210. (b) The
term executive director shall mean the executive director of the New York State

Science and Technology Foundation. (c) The term board shall mean the board of
directors of the New York State Science and Technology Foundation. (d) The term Research and Development Grants

Program shall mean the foundation program of competitive awards to support
research and development projects having distinct potential for industrial
application or that contribute otherwise to the State's economic
development. (e) The term applicant
shall mean any educational institution, nonprofit institution or organization, business enterprise or other person concerned with scientific and technological
research, development and/or education in the State submitting a proposal to
receive assistance under the Research and Development Grants Program. (f) The term research and review committee
shall mean the committee designated by the New York State Science and

Technology Foundation to review and evaluate proposals made for assistance
under the Research and Development Grants Program. Notes

5903.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
